name: Yanru Qu

education.degree_name: Beijing University of Chemical Technology, Polymer Material Engineering, Elite Class
education.university: (Top 30 students selected by highest score when entering university/second round selection after the first year)

research.title: Construction of NIR II-responsive Antibacterial/antifouling Switchable Surface
info: Researched more than 40 published studies around the area of stimuli-responsive switchable antibacterial in one week to analyze the corresponding research background and bottleneck.

Designed function-switchable antibacterial/antifouling surface responding to NIR II stimuli, for the first time realizing precise responding towards adventitious stimuli by including fabrication of twice stimuli-response and LCST adjusting of polymer.
Synthesized antibacterial surface on titanium sheet and tested the inhibition rate of bacteria growth.
Writing a review around research topic, “The progress on smart stimuli-responsive antibacterial material for wound healing”.
Selected as national project in China College Students’ Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition. (13/79)

research.title: Multi-metallic Polyphthalocyanine (PPc): Fabrication and Electrocatalysis Application
research.organization: State Key Laboratory of Chemical Resource Engineering
info: Researched studies on high-entropy alloy, polyphthalocyanine and electrochemistry.
Synthesized FeCoNiCu-AMPPC (AM= Mg, Ca, Sr, Ba) respectively, characterized (SEM, FTIR, UV Raman spectra and XRD) and tested corresponding electrocatalysis performance.
Fabricated single-layer FeCoNiCu-AMPPC by ball-milling.
Taking the merits of single-atom catalysis (SAC), synthesized MPPc (M= Mg, Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Ni, Cu, Zn, Ru, Rh, Pd, Ag, W, Ir, Pt, Au), respectively.

research.title: Integrated Electrodes for Rechargeable Batteries
research.organization: State Key Laboratory of Chemical Resource Engineering
info: Researched more than 100 published studies to analyze the merits, application and challenge of integrated electrode.
Writing a review, “Design and Construction of Carbon-based Integrated Electrodes for Rechargeable Batteries: Status and Prospects”.

research.title: Preparation and Application of Supercapacitor by Bi-metal Activation Method
research.organization: State Key Laboratory of Chemical Resource Engineering
info: Analyzed the composition and current utilization situation of wasted rubber, to optimize its recycling and exert the merits of composition for energy storage equipment.
Synthesized hierarchical porous carbon by hydrothermal of wasted rubber with variable of two different activated agent to carbon precursor ratio.
Characterized material and tested the electrochemical capacity performance of the supercapacitor to analyze the specific surface area of porous carbon and its performance in supercapacitor.

Finished a review based on the project designed idea—effective utilization of wasted materials in energy storage, “The synthesis strategy and application in supercapacitor of hierarchical porous carbon from waste-based materials”.

research.title: The Application of Density Function Theory In Li–S Battery
research.organization: State Key Laboratory of Chemical Resource Engineering
info: Gained the basic knowledge of DFT calculation, including its main application and specific calculation methods.
Researched the recent progress of Li-S battery and focused on the role of DFT calculation.

Finished a review based on the project designed idea—effective utilization of wasted materials in energy storage, “The synthesis strategy and application in supercapacitor of hierarchical porous carbon from waste-based materials”.

research.title: Construction of Novel Antibacterial and Anti-Biofilm Polymer Based on Polymyxin B and D-Amino Acid
info: Inspired by a published work about the anti-biofilm function of D-amino acid, tended to  a polymer to integrate anti-biofilm and antibacterial function.
Grafted D-amino and QPEI on polymer PGMA backbone.

Characterized materials and tested the ability of killing bacterial and dispersing biofilm, proving the excellent antibacterial efficiency but inferior ability to disperse biofilm of D-Tyr in the working form as touching.
Adjusted the aiming product to synthesize antibacterial micelle with polymer as backbone packing D-Tyr.
Led team to enter the Creativity Competition Experimental Project and selected as key project in college (TOP 5).
Won outstanding prize in the first National Polymer Material Innovation& Entrepreneurship Competition. (30/400+)

research.title: The Surface Functional Modification of Antibacterial Polymer
info: Researched recent progress on antibacterial materials and focused on polymer
Led team to enter a scientific research competition in university with a review completed, “The surface functional modification of antibacterial polymer and the application in biomedical material”.

Published paper on Surface Technology (EI compendex& Chinese core journal).
(Qu et al. Preparation and Application of Multifunctional Quaternary Ammonium Polymers for The Engineering of Novel Antibacterial Materials[J]. Surface Technology, 2019, 220-228. (First author))
(Supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (51573014, 21504006))

publication.title: Yanru Qu, Haolei Zhang, Chuankai Shen, Dongyuan Cui, Xiaokang Ding*. Preparation and Application of Multifunctional Quaternary Ammonium Polymers for The Engineering of Novel Antibacterial Materials[J]. Surface Technology, 2019, 220-228.

Jianbo Li,‡ Yanru Qu, ‡ Chunyuan Chen, Xin Zhang,* and Mingfei Shao*. Theoretical Investigation on Lithium Polysulfides Adsorption and Conversion for High-Performance Li−S Batteries[J]. Nanoscale, 2020. (Accepted)
